title: Timing Your Post-Exercise Supplements for Faster Fatigue Recovery
description: Meta-analysis shows that taking protein and carbs immediately post-workout speeds up muscle and glycogen recovery compared to delayed intake.

sections.title: Immediate vs Delayed Supplementation
sections.content: A recent systematic review concludes that taking protein and carbohydrates right after exercise significantly enhances muscle recovery, glycogen replenishment, and reduces fatigue more than delayed supplementation—especially after intense training.

sections.title: Practical Tip
sections.content: For optimal recovery, aim to consume a mix of carbs and protein within 30–60 minutes post-workout.

sources.title: Frontiers in Nutrition: Nutritional Supplement Timing and Recovery
sources.author: Cheng et al., Frontiers in Nutrition
